reviewText:
Fundamentally cruddy, broken and unfinished, an opportunity gone to waste.

The UI and menus are an eyesore and mostly don't make any sense and furthermore aren't even translated (from Russian) in some places despite setting the language to English.

There's supposedly lots of content, cars, tracks and customization, yet every race plays and feels the same, which in MadOut's case is not a good thing. There's no objectives, tracks are extremely linear and bland, the cars handle like shopping carts and the weapons don't really do anything at all.

All the advertized visual settings don't do anything for the game because even maxed out it's painful to look at. Mind you most of the sceenshots and even the trailer video are heavily post processed, for a good reason.

MadOut needs a complete rework in order to justify any kind of pricetag.
Do not buy this; it's ♥♥♥♥.

reviewText: while the handling and damage model is acceptable, rest of the game is not worth that money. tracks are boring, textures are terrible. There are translation errors and text overlapping in the menus. It feels like mobile game more. if it was 3x cheaper it would be acceptable i guess.

reviewText: If you are on Windows, don't buy it, you have better options like the BugBear's games FlatOut, FlatOut2 and Wreckfest.\n\nBut if you are on Linux and haven't another options, maybe you can enjoy it. This game has nice graphics, a good  soundtrack, nice cars and nice speed effects, but suffers with boring racing tracks and has some erros that you just don't believe how the developers do not correct before release it on Steam (like the position counter, which is wrong for most of the time).  It is like 70/100.

reviewText:
Beautiful graphics, but that doesn't mean good game. Being 1st means you were lucky btw.

Only 1 mode.
All maps feel same.
Game of luck.
Boring menus.
Some things aren't really translated.
Pretty bad handling, making driving boring.
No punishment on dying or on others being killed by you.
Unfair combat system (impossible to dodge and almost impossible to miss anything. Only shield will protect you, but with it you can't win. Then again not having it means losing. Try to quickly get to 1st then take shields and a little ammo in case someone gets past you)

I won once, check my screenshot. I broke the game.

reviewText: Nice game. Full of action, and relatively tough. I was playing the second level and had a hard time winning the race that I wondered whether I was playing against AI or online.\nThe game works well on Linux (Fedora) and works also on AMD open source drivers with good performance.\nThe game is well worth the price.

reviewText: Arcade type game. Not bad. UI could use a little work; I couldn't turn off obnoxious music. Under 64-bit linux it was missing a i386 library (run sudo apt-get install libreadline6:i386); see forum post https://steamcommunity.com/app/352170/discussions/0/615086038671746098/ .\n\nI think the idea for developers is to enter the <=$5 android market.

It's really overpriced. For that amount you get crappy graphics, a bad gameplay, a nonexistence story. I really don't recommend it

This game is fun but also needlessly frustrating. Victories feel largely left to chance due to poor AI and a punishing combat system. My main issue, however, is that the game cannot be played offline and save data is stored on the company's servers as opposed to your local system. In summary, this is a cool Blur like racing game, especially for those of us on Linux since Blur isn't available to us at this point. If the aforementioned issues are fixed then I would even call this a great game.
